Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Memory Leak in ReadRLAImage in coders/rla.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.7-17 Q16, there are memory leaks in ReadRLAImage in coders/rla.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in coders/dcm.c:ReadDCImage can cause denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.7-22 Q16 has memory leaks in the ReadDCMImage function in coders/dcm.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in coders/json.c:EncodeImageAttributes could cause crash
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.7-22 Q16 has memory leaks in the EncodeImageAttributes function in coders/json.c, as demonstrated by the ReadPSDLayersInternal function in coders/psd.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Memory leak in coders/dcm.c:ReadDCMImage can allow for denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: In the ReadDCMImage function in coders/dcm.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.7-23, each redmap, greenmap, and bluemap variable can be overwritten by a new pointer. The previous pointer is lost, which leads to a memory leak. This allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Memory allocation failure in ReadTIFFImage function in memory.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: The ReadTIFFImage function in coders/tiff.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-23 Q16 does not properly validate the amount of image data in a file, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure in the AcquireMagickMemory function in MagickCore/memory.c).

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: denial of service (DoS) in IsWEBPImageLossless function in coders/webp.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in ImageMagick 7.0.7-22 Q16. The IsWEBPImageLossless function in coders/webp.c allows attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation violation) via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: double free in WriteEPTImage function in coders/ept.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: WriteEPTImage in coders/ept.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-25 Q16 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (MagickCore/memory.c double free and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-buffer-overflow in ReadTIFFImage function in coders/tiff.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: The ReadTIFFImage function in coders/tiff.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-26 Q16 does not properly restrict memory allocation, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: excessive iteration in the DecodeLabImage and EncodeLabImage functions in coders/tiff.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.7-26 Q16 has excessive iteration in the DecodeLabImage and EncodeLabImage functions (coders/tiff.c), which results in a hang (tens of minutes) with a tiny PoC file. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted tiff file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Heap-based buffer over-read in coders/webp.c:IsWEBPImageLossless()
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.7-24 Q16, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in IsWEBPImageLossless in coders/webp.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in SVGKeyValuePairs of coders/svg.c that leads to denial of service via crafted image file
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.8-36 Q16, there is a memory leak in the function SVGKeyValuePairs of coders/svg.c, which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted image file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: denial of service in ReadXWDImage in coders/xwd.c in the XWD image parsing component
Vulnerabilities.Description: ReadXWDImage in coders/xwd.c in the XWD image parsing component of ImageMagick 7.0.8-41 Q16 allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service (divide-by-zero error) by crafting an XWD image file in which the header indicates neither LSB first nor MSB first.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in the function WriteTIFFImage of coders/tiff.c leading to DoS or information disclosure
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.8-43 Q16, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function WriteTIFFImage of coders/tiff.c, which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or possibly information disclosure via a crafted image file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in the function WritePNMImage of coders/pnm.c leading to DoS or information disclosure
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.8-40 Q16, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function WritePNMImage of coders/pnm.c, which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or possibly information disclosure via a crafted image file. This is related to SetGrayscaleImage in MagickCore/quantize.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: imagemagick: null-pointer dereference in function ReadPANGOImage in coders/pango.c and ReadVIDImage in coders/vid.c causing denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: A NULL pointer dereference in the function ReadPANGOImage in coders/pango.c and the function ReadVIDImage in coders/vid.c in ImageMagick 7.0.8-34 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted image.

Vulnerabilities.Title: imagemagick: memory leak vulnerability in function WriteDPXImage in coders/dpx.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-34 has a memory leak vulnerability in the WriteDPXImage function in coders/dpx.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: imagemagick: memory leak vulnerability in function ReadPCLImage in coders/pcl.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-34 has a memory leak in the ReadPCLImage function in coders/pcl.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: imagemagick: use of uninitialised value in function WriteJP2Image in coders/jp2.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-34 has a "use of uninitialized value" vulnerability in the WriteJP2Image function in coders/jp2.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: imagemagick: use of uninitialized value in function ReadPANGOImage in coders/pango.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-34 has a "use of uninitialized value" vulnerability in the ReadPANGOImage function in coders/pango.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: imagemagick: use of uninitialized value in functionSyncImageSettings in MagickCore/image.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-34 has a "use of uninitialized value" vulnerability in the SyncImageSettings function in MagickCore/image.c. This is related to AcquireImage in magick/image.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: a "use of uninitialized value" vulnerability in the function ReadCUTImage leading to a crash and DoS
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick before 7.0.8-50 has a "use of uninitialized value" vulnerability in the function ReadCUTImage in coders/cut.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: a memory leak vulnerability in the function ReadPSImage in coders/ps.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick before 7.0.8-50 has a memory leak vulnerability in the function ReadPSImage in coders/ps.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read at MagickCore/threshold.c in AdaptiveThresholdImage because a width of zero is mishandled
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer over-read at MagickCore/threshold.c in AdaptiveThresholdImage because a width of zero is mishandled.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read at MagickCore/threshold.c in AdaptiveThresholdImage because a height of zero is mishandled
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer over-read at MagickCore/threshold.c in AdaptiveThresholdImage because a height of zero is mishandled.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer overflow at MagickCore/statistic.c in EvaluateImages because of mishandling columns
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer overflow at MagickCore/statistic.c in EvaluateImages because of mishandling columns.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leaks in AcquireMagickMemory
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has memory leaks in AcquireMagickMemory because of an AnnotateImage error.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: stack-based buffer overflow at coders/pnm.c in WritePNMImage because of a misplaced assignment
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a stack-based buffer overflow at coders/pnm.c in WritePNMImage because of a misplaced assignment.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: stack-based buffer overflow at coders/pnm.c in WritePNMImage because of a misplaced strncpy and an off-by-one error
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a stack-based buffer overflow at coders/pnm.c in WritePNMImage because of a misplaced strncpy and an off-by-one error.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: stack-based buffer overflow at coders/pnm.c in WritePNMImage because of off-by-one errors
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a stack-based buffer overflow at coders/pnm.c in WritePNMImage because of off-by-one errors.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer overflow at MagickCore/statistic.c in EvaluateImages because of mishandling rows
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer overflow at MagickCore/statistic.c in EvaluateImages because of mishandling rows.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer overflow in MagickCore/fourier.c in ComplexImage
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a heap-based buffer overflow in MagickCore/fourier.c in ComplexImage.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leaks at AcquireMagickMemory due to mishandling the NoSuchImage error in CLIListOperatorImages
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has memory leaks at AcquireMagickMemory because of mishandling the NoSuchImage error in CLIListOperatorImages in MagickWand/operation.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leaks at AcquireMagickMemory because of an error in MagickWand/mogrify.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has memory leaks at AcquireMagickMemory because of an error in MagickWand/mogrify.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leaks at AcquireMagickMemory because of a wand/mogrify.c error
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has memory leaks at AcquireMagickMemory because of a wand/mogrify.c error.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in MagickCore/fourier.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16, ComplexImages in MagickCore/fourier.c has a heap-based buffer over-read because of incorrect calls to GetCacheViewVirtualPixels.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: division by zero in RemoveDuplicateLayers in MagickCore/layer.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-54 Q16 allows Division by Zero in RemoveDuplicateLayers in MagickCore/layer.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: division by zero in MeanShiftImage in MagickCore/feature.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.x before 7.0.8-41 and 6.x before 6.9.10-41, there is a divide-by-zero vulnerability in the MeanShiftImage function. It allows an attacker to cause a denial of service by sending a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: out-of-bounds read in ReadXWDImage in coders/xwd.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: The XWD image (X Window System window dumping file) parsing component in ImageMagick 7.0.8-41 Q16 allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service (application crash resulting from an out-of-bounds Read) in ReadXWDImage in coders/xwd.c by crafting a corrupted XWD image file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2019-11472.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Use after free in ReadMATImage in coders/mat.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: coders/mat.c in ImageMagick 7.0.8-43 Q16 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by crafting a Matlab image file that is mishandled in ReadImage in MagickCore/constitute.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in magick/xwindow.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-35 has a memory leak in magick/xwindow.c, related to XCreateImage.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in coders/dps.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-35 has a memory leak in coders/dps.c, as demonstrated by XCreateImage.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in coders/dot.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-35 has a memory leak in coders/dot.c, as demonstrated by AcquireMagickMemory in MagickCore/memory.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in Huffman2DEncodeImage in coders/ps2.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-40 has a memory leak in Huffman2DEncodeImage in coders/ps2.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in Huffman2DEncodeImage in coders/ps3.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-43 has a memory leak in Huffman2DEncodeImage in coders/ps3.c, as demonstrated by WritePS3Image.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: memory leak in coders/dot.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-43 has a memory leak in coders/dot.c, as demonstrated by PingImage in MagickCore/constitute.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in WritePNGImage in coders/png.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.8-43 Q16, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function WritePNGImage of coders/png.c, related to Magick_png_write_raw_profile and LocaleNCompare.

Vulnerabilities.Title: imagemagick: memory leak in function DecodeImage in coders/pcd.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, some memory leaks exist in DecodeImage in coders/pcd.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Memory leak in the WritePSDChannel function in coders/psd.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, a memory leak exists in WritePSDChannel in coders/psd.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Memory leak in the ReadSIXELImage function in coders/sixel.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, a memory leak exists in ReadSIXELImage in coders/sixel.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Memory leak in the WritePDFImage function in coders/pdf.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25 and GraphicsMagick through 1.3.31, several memory leaks exist in WritePDFImage in coders/pdf.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: Memory leak in the WriteDIBImage function in coders/dib.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, a memory leak exists in WriteDIBImage in coders/dib.c.

A design flaw in image processing software that modifies JPEG images might not modify the original EXIF thumbnail, which could lead to an information leak of potentially sensitive visual information that had been removed from the main JPEG image.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ImageMagick: off-by-one read in formatIPTCfromBuffer function in coders/meta.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: An off-by-one read vulnerability was discovered in ImageMagick before version 7.0.7-28 in the formatIPTCfromBuffer function in coders/meta.c. A local attacker may use this flaw to read beyond the end of the buffer or to crash the program.

Vulnerabilities.Title: mysql: Server: Stored Procedure unspecified vulnerability (CPU Apr 2020)
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Stored Procedure). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.47 and prior, 5.7.29 and prior and 8.0.19 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

Vulnerabilities.Title: mysql: InnoDB unspecified vulnerability (CPU Apr 2020)
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.47 and prior, 5.7.28 and prior and 8.0.18 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

Vulnerabilities.Title: mysql: C API unspecified vulnerability (CPU Apr 2020)
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: C API). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.47 and prior, 5.7.27 and prior and 8.0.17 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Client. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Client. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 5.3 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

Vulnerabilities.Title: mysql: Server: Stored Procedure unspecified vulnerability (CPU Apr 2020)
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Stored Procedure). Vulnerabilities.Title: util-linux: runuser tty hijack via TIOCSTI ioctl
Vulnerabilities.Description: runuser in util-linux allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

Vulnerabilities.Title: gcc: spilling of stack protection address in cfgexpand.c and function.c leads to stack-overflow protection bypass
Vulnerabilities.Description: stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ncurses: Null pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ncurses 6.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c that will lead to a denial of service attack. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `*' in name or alias field" detection.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ncurses: heap-based buffer overflow in the _nc_find_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the _nc_find_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ncurses: heap-based buffer overflow in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ncurses: Null pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In ncurses 6.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c that will lead to a denial of service attack. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `*' in name or alias field" detection.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ncurses: heap-based buffer overflow in the _nc_find_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the _nc_find_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

Vulnerabilities.Title: ncurses: heap-based buffer overflow in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

Vulnerabilities.Description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the _nc_find_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

Vulnerabilities.Title: nettle: Leaky data conversion exposing a manager oracle
Vulnerabilities.Description: A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way nettle handles endian conversion of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run a process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this flaw extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

Vulnerabilities.Title: nghttp2: Null pointer dereference when too large ALTSVC frame is received
Vulnerabilities.Description: nghttp2 version >= 1.10.0 and nghttp2 <= v1.31.0 contains an Improper Input Validation CWE-20 vulnerability in ALTSVC frame handling that can result in segmentation fault leading to denial of service. This attack appears to be exploitable via network client. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in >= 1.31.1.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: heap-based buffer over-read in hufDecode function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, a crafted image causes a heap-based buffer over-read in the hufDecode function in IlmImf/ImfHuf.cpp during exrmaketiled execution; it may result in denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Excessive memory allocation in Header::readfrom
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** Header::readfrom in IlmImf/ImfHeader.cpp in OpenEXR 2.2.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation) via a crafted file that is accessed with the ImfOpenInputFile function in IlmImf/ImfCRgbaFile.cpp. NOTE: The maintainer and multiple third parties believe that this vulnerability isn't valid.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds read in the hufDecode function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 2 in the hufDecode function in ImfHuf.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds write in the storeSSE function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 8 in the storeSSE function in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds read in the getBits function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the getBits function in ImfHuf.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds write in the bufferedReadPixels function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 1 in the bufferedReadPixels function in ImfInputFile.cpp could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds read in the refill function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the refill function in ImfFastHuf.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds write in the = operator function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 2 in the = operator function in half.h could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds read in the uncompress function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the uncompress function in ImfZip.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Memory leak in ThreadPool in in IlmBase/IlmThread/IlmThreadPool.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: OpenEXR 2.3.0 has a memory leak in ThreadPool in IlmBase/IlmThread/IlmThreadPool.cpp, as demonstrated by exrmultiview.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds write in makeMultiView.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: makeMultiView.cpp in exrmultiview in OpenEXR 2.3.0 has an out-of-bounds write, leading to an assertion failure or possibly unspecified other impact.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds write due to integer overflows in CompositeDeepScanLine::Data::handleDeepFrameBuffer and readSampleCountForLineBlock
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. Because of integer overflows in CompositeDeepScanLine::Data::handleDeepFrameBuffer and readSampleCountForLineBlock, an attacker can write to an out-of-bounds pointer.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read during RLE uncompression in rleUncompress function in ImfRle.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read during RLE uncompression in rleUncompress in ImfRle.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read during Huffman uncompression
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read during Huffman uncompression, as demonstrated by FastHufDecoder::refill in ImfFastHuf.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read and write in DwaCompressor::uncompress in ImfDwaCompressor.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read and write in DwaCompressor::uncompress in ImfDwaCompressor.cpp when handling the UNKNOWN compression case.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: std::vector out-of-bounds read and write as demonstrated by ImfTileOffsets.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an std::vector out-of-bounds read and write, as demonstrated by ImfTileOffsets.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds write in copyIntoFrameBuffer function in ImfMisc.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds write in copyIntoFrameBuffer in ImfMisc.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: off-by-one error in ImfXdr.h read function by DwaCompressor::Classifier::Classifier leading to an out-of-bounds read
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an off-by-one error in use of the ImfXdr.h read function by DwaCompressor::Classifier::Classifier, leading to an out-of-bounds read.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: heap-based buffer over-read in hufDecode function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, a crafted image causes a heap-based buffer over-read in the hufDecode function in IlmImf/ImfHuf.cpp during exrmaketiled execution; it may result in denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Excessive memory allocation in Header::readfrom
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** Header::readfrom in IlmImf/ImfHeader.cpp in OpenEXR 2.2.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation) via a crafted file that is accessed with the ImfOpenInputFile function in IlmImf/ImfCRgbaFile.cpp. NOTE: The maintainer and multiple third parties believe that this vulnerability isn't valid.

Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 2 in the hufDecode function in ImfHuf.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 8 in the storeSSE function in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds read in the getBits function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the getBits function in ImfHuf.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds write in the bufferedReadPixels function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 1 in the bufferedReadPixels function in ImfInputFile.cpp could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds read in the refill function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the refill function in ImfFastHuf.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 2 in the = operator function in half.h could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds read in the uncompress function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid read of size 1 in the uncompress function in ImfZip.cpp could cause the application to crash.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Memory leak in ThreadPool in in IlmBase/IlmThread/IlmThreadPool.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: OpenEXR 2.3.0 has a memory leak in ThreadPool in IlmBase/IlmThread/IlmThreadPool.cpp, as demonstrated by exrmultiview.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: Out-of-bounds write in makeMultiView.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: makeMultiView.cpp in exrmultiview in OpenEXR 2.3.0 has an out-of-bounds write, leading to an assertion failure or possibly unspecified other impact.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read in ImfOptimizedPixelReading.h.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds write due to integer overflows in CompositeDeepScanLine::Data::handleDeepFrameBuffer and readSampleCountForLineBlock
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. Because of integer overflows in CompositeDeepScanLine::Data::handleDeepFrameBuffer and readSampleCountForLineBlock, an attacker can write to an out-of-bounds pointer.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read during RLE uncompression in rleUncompress function in ImfRle.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read during RLE uncompression in rleUncompress in ImfRle.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read during Huffman uncompression
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read during Huffman uncompression, as demonstrated by FastHufDecoder::refill in ImfFastHuf.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds read and write in DwaCompressor::uncompress in ImfDwaCompressor.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds read and write in DwaCompressor::uncompress in ImfDwaCompressor.cpp when handling the UNKNOWN compression case.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: std::vector out-of-bounds read and write as demonstrated by ImfTileOffsets.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an std::vector out-of-bounds read and write, as demonstrated by ImfTileOffsets.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: out-of-bounds write in copyIntoFrameBuffer function in ImfMisc.cpp
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an out-of-bounds write in copyIntoFrameBuffer in ImfMisc.cpp.

Vulnerabilities.Title: OpenEXR: off-by-one error in ImfXdr.h read function by DwaCompressor::Classifier::Classifier leading to an out-of-bounds read
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEXR before 2.4.1. There is an off-by-one error in use of the ImfXdr.h read function by DwaCompressor::Classifier::Classifier, leading to an out-of-bounds read.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Stack-buffer overflow in the pgxtoimage function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.

An issue was discovered in mj2/opj_mj2_extract.c in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. The output prefix was not checked for length, which could overflow a buffer, when providing a prefix with 50 or more characters on the command line.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: NULL pointer dereference in imagetopnm function in convert.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: NULL pointer dereference vulnerabilities in the imagetopnm function in convert.c, sycc444_to_rgb function in color.c, color_esycc_to_rgb function in color.c, and sycc422_to_rgb function in color.c in OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted j2k files.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Division by zero in functions opj_pi_next_cprl, opj_pi_next_pcrl, and opj_pi_next_rpcl in pi.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions opj_pi_next_cprl, opj_pi_next_pcrl, and opj_pi_next_rpcl in pi.c in OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted j2k files.

Vulnerabilities.Title: CVE-2016-9114 CVE-2016-9115 CVE-2016-9116 CVE-2016-9117 CVE-2016-9118 openjpeg2: Multiple security issues
Vulnerabilities.Description: There is a NULL pointer dereference in function imagetobmp of convertbmp.c:980 of OpenJPEG 2.1.2. image->comps[0].data is not assigned a value after initialization(NULL). Impact is Denial of Service.

Vulnerabilities.Title: CVE-2016-9113 CVE-2016-9114 CVE-2016-9115 CVE-2016-9116 CVE-2016-9117 CVE-2016-9118 openjpeg2: Multiple security issues
Vulnerabilities.Description: There is a NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm of convert.c:1943(jp2) of OpenJPEG 2.1.2. image->comps[compno].data is not assigned a value after initialization(NULL). Impact is Denial of Service.

Vulnerabilities.Title: CVE-2016-9113 CVE-2016-9114 CVE-2016-9115 CVE-2016-9116 CVE-2016-9117 CVE-2016-9118 openjpeg2: Multiple security issues
Vulnerabilities.Description: Heap Buffer Over-read in function imagetotga of convert.c(jp2):942 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2. Impact is Denial of Service. Someone must open a crafted j2k file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: CVE-2016-9113 CVE-2016-9114 CVE-2016-9115 CVE-2016-9116 CVE-2016-9117 CVE-2016-9118 openjpeg2: Multiple security issues
Vulnerabilities.Description: NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm of convert.c:2226(jp2) in OpenJPEG 2.1.2. Impact is Denial of Service. Someone must open a crafted j2k file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: CVE-2016-9113 CVE-2016-9114 CVE-2016-9115 CVE-2016-9116 CVE-2016-9117 CVE-2016-9118 openjpeg2: Multiple security issues
Vulnerabilities.Description: NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm of convert.c(jp2):1289 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2. Impact is Denial of Service. Someone must open a crafted j2k file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg2: Integer overflow in tiftoimage causes heap buffer overflow
Vulnerabilities.Description: An integer overflow vulnerability was found in tiftoimage function in openjpeg 2.1.2, resulting in heap buffer overflow.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg2: Infinite loop in tiftoimage resulting into heap buffer overflow in convert_32s_C1P1
Vulnerabilities.Description: An infinite loop vulnerability in tiftoimage that results in heap buffer overflow in convert_32s_C1P1 was found in openjpeg 2.1.2.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Memory allocation failure in the opj_image_create function
Vulnerabilities.Description: The bmp_read_info_header function in bin/jp2/convertbmp.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0 does not reject headers with a zero biBitCount, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure) in the opj_image_create function in lib/openjp2/image.c, related to the opj_aligned_alloc_n function in opj_malloc.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Heap-based buffer overflow in pnmtoimage function in bin/jpwl/convert.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. Missing checks for header_info.height and header_info.width in the function pnmtoimage in bin/jpwl/convert.c can lead to a heap-based buffer overflow.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Heap-based buffer overflow in function t2_encode_packet in src/lib/openmj2/t2.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in the function t2_encode_packet in lib/openmj2/t2.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: division-by-zero in function pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_cprl, and pi_next_rpcl in openmj2/pi.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_cprl, and pi_next_rpcl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash).

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: out-of-bounds read in functions pi_next_lrcp, pi_next_rlcp, pi_next_rpcl, pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_rpcl, and pi_next_cprl in openmj2/pi.c leads to denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: Out-of-bounds accesses in the functions pi_next_lrcp, pi_next_rlcp, pi_next_rpcl, pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_rpcl, and pi_next_cprl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash).

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: integer overflow in opj_t1_encode_cblks in src/lib/openjp2/t1.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, there is an integer overflow vulnerability in the opj_t1_encode_cblks function (openjp2/t1.c). Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: denial of service in function opj_t1_encode_cblks in openjp2/t1.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.1, there is excessive iteration in the opj_t1_encode_cblks function of openjp2/t1.c. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file. This issue is similar to CVE-2018-6616.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: DoS via memory exhaustion in opj_decompress
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. It allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (attempted excessive memory allocation) in opj_calloc in openjp2/opj_malloc.c, when called from opj_tcd_init_tile in openjp2/tcd.c, as demonstrated by the 64-bit opj_decompress.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Heap-based buffer overflow in opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor()
Vulnerabilities.Description: OpenJPEG through 2.3.1 has a heap-based buffer overflow in opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c because of lack of opj_j2k_update_image_dimensions validation.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: heap-based buffer overflow in pj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c in OpenJPEG 2.3.1 through 2020-01-28 has a heap-based buffer overflow in the qmfbid==1 case, a different issue than CVE-2020-6851.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Stack-buffer overflow in the pgxtoimage function
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.

An issue was discovered in mj2/opj_mj2_extract.c in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. The output prefix was not checked for length, which could overflow a buffer, when providing a prefix with 50 or more characters on the command line.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: NULL pointer dereference in imagetopnm function in convert.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: NULL pointer dereference vulnerabilities in the imagetopnm function in convert.c, sycc444_to_rgb function in color.c, color_esycc_to_rgb function in color.c, and sycc422_to_rgb function in color.c in OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted j2k files.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Division by zero in functions opj_pi_next_cprl, opj_pi_next_pcrl, and opj_pi_next_rpcl in pi.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions opj_pi_next_cprl, opj_pi_next_pcrl, and opj_pi_next_rpcl in pi.c in OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted j2k files.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg2: Integer overflow in tiftoimage causes heap buffer overflow
Vulnerabilities.Description: An integer overflow vulnerability was found in tiftoimage function in openjpeg 2.1.2, resulting in heap buffer overflow.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg2: Infinite loop in tiftoimage resulting into heap buffer overflow in convert_32s_C1P1
Vulnerabilities.Description: An infinite loop vulnerability in tiftoimage that results in heap buffer overflow in convert_32s_C1P1 was found in openjpeg 2.1.2.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Memory allocation failure in the opj_image_create function
Vulnerabilities.Description: The bmp_read_info_header function in bin/jp2/convertbmp.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0 does not reject headers with a zero biBitCount, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure) in the opj_image_create function in lib/openjp2/image.c, related to the opj_aligned_alloc_n function in opj_malloc.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Heap-based buffer overflow in pnmtoimage function in bin/jpwl/convert.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. Missing checks for header_info.height and header_info.width in the function pnmtoimage in bin/jpwl/convert.c can lead to a heap-based buffer overflow.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Heap-based buffer overflow in function t2_encode_packet in src/lib/openmj2/t2.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in the function t2_encode_packet in lib/openmj2/t2.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: division-by-zero in function pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_cprl, and pi_next_rpcl in openmj2/pi.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_cprl, and pi_next_rpcl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash).

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: out-of-bounds read in functions pi_next_lrcp, pi_next_rlcp, pi_next_rpcl, pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_rpcl, and pi_next_cprl in openmj2/pi.c leads to denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: Out-of-bounds accesses in the functions pi_next_lrcp, pi_next_rlcp, pi_next_rpcl, pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_rpcl, and pi_next_cprl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash).

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: integer overflow in opj_t1_encode_cblks in src/lib/openjp2/t1.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, there is an integer overflow vulnerability in the opj_t1_encode_cblks function (openjp2/t1.c). Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: denial of service in function opj_t1_encode_cblks in openjp2/t1.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.1, there is excessive iteration in the opj_t1_encode_cblks function of openjp2/t1.c. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file. This issue is similar to CVE-2018-6616.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: DoS via memory exhaustion in opj_decompress
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. It allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (attempted excessive memory allocation) in opj_calloc in openjp2/opj_malloc.c, when called from opj_tcd_init_tile in openjp2/tcd.c, as demonstrated by the 64-bit opj_decompress.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: Heap-based buffer overflow in opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor()
Vulnerabilities.Description: OpenJPEG through 2.3.1 has a heap-based buffer overflow in opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c because of lack of opj_j2k_update_image_dimensions validation.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openjpeg: heap-based buffer overflow in pj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c in OpenJPEG 2.3.1 through 2020-01-28 has a heap-based buffer overflow in the qmfbid==1 case, a different issue than CVE-2020-6851.

Vulnerabilities.Title: graphviz: NULL pointer dereference in rebuild_vlis
Vulnerabilities.Description: NULL pointer dereference vulnerability in the rebuild_vlists function in lib/dotgen/conc.c in the dotgen library in Graphviz 2.40.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: graphviz: null pointer dereference in function agroot() in cgraph\obj.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: The agroot() function in cgraph\obj.c in libcgraph.a in Graphviz 2.39.20160612.1140 has a NULL pointer dereference, as demonstrated by graphml2gv.

Vulnerabilities.Title: graphviz: recursive function call in agclose in lib\cgraph\graph.c causing stack consumption
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in lib\cdt\dttree.c in libcdt.a in graphviz 2.40.1. Stack consumption occurs because of recursive agclose calls in lib\cgraph\graph.c in libcgraph.a, related to agfstsubg in lib\cgraph\subg.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: stack-based buffer overflow write in pcre32_copy_substring
Vulnerabilities.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 4) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: stack-based buffer overflow write in pcre32_copy_substring
Vulnerabilities.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 268) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: self-recursive call in match() in pcre_exec.c leads to denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** In PCRE 8.41, after compiling, a pcretest load test PoC produces a crash overflow in the function match() in pcre_exec.c because of a self-recursive call. NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this report, noting that there are options that can be used to limit the amount of stack that is used.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: stack-based buffer overflow write in pcre32_copy_substring
Vulnerabilities.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 4) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: stack-based buffer overflow write in pcre32_copy_substring
Vulnerabilities.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 268) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** In PCRE 8.41, after compiling, a pcretest load test PoC produces a crash overflow in the function match() in pcre_exec.c because of a self-recursive call. NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this report, noting that there are options that can be used to limit the amount of stack that is used.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: stack-based buffer overflow write in pcre32_copy_substring
Vulnerabilities.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 4) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pcre: stack-based buffer overflow write in pcre32_copy_substring
Vulnerabilities.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 268) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this report, noting that there are options that can be used to limit the amount of stack that is used.

Vulnerabilities.Title: perl: heap-based buffer overflow in regular expression compiler leads to DoS
Vulnerabilities.Description: Perl before 5.30.3 on 32-bit platforms allows a heap-based buffer overflow because nested regular expression quantifiers have an integer overflow.

Vulnerabilities.Title: perl: corruption of intermediate language state of compiled regular expression due to integer overflow leads to DoS
Vulnerabilities.Description: Perl before 5.30.3 has an integer overflow related to mishandling of a "PL_regkind[OP(n)] == NOTHING" situation. A crafted regular expression could lead to malformed bytecode with a possibility of instruction injection.

Vulnerabilities.Title: perl: File::Temp insecure temporary file handling
Vulnerabilities.Description: _is_safe in the File::Temp module for Perl does not properly handle symlinks.

Vulnerabilities.Title: perl: corruption of intermediate language state of compiled regular expression due to recursive S_study_chunk() calls leads to DoS
Vulnerabilities.Description: regcomp.c in Perl before 5.30.3 allows a buffer overflow via a crafted regular expression because of recursive S_study_chunk calls.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: does not check length of chunks against user limit
Vulnerabilities.Description: libpng before 1.6.32 does not properly check the length of chunks against the user limit.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: Segmentation fault in png.c:png_free_data function causing denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue has been found in libpng 1.6.34. It is a SEGV in the function png_free_data in png.c, related to the recommended error handling for png_read_image.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: Stack-based buffer overflow in contrib/pngminus/pnm2png.c:get_token() potentially leading to arbitrary code execution
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue has been found in third-party PNM decoding associated with libpng 1.6.35. It is a stack-based buffer overflow in the function get_token in pnm2png.c in pnm2png.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: memory leak of png_info struct in pngcp.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** png_create_info_struct in png.c in libpng 1.6.36 has a memory leak, as demonstrated by pngcp. NOTE: a third party has stated "I don't think it is libpng's job to free this buffer."

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: does not check length of chunks against user limit
Vulnerabilities.Description: libpng before 1.6.32 does not properly check the length of chunks against the user limit.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: Segmentation fault in png.c:png_free_data function causing denial of service
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue has been found in libpng 1.6.34. It is a SEGV in the function png_free_data in png.c, related to the recommended error handling for png_read_image.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: Stack-based buffer overflow in contrib/pngminus/pnm2png.c:get_token() potentially leading to arbitrary code execution
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue has been found in third-party PNM decoding associated with libpng 1.6.35. It is a stack-based buffer overflow in the function get_token in pnm2png.c in pnm2png.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libpng: memory leak of png_info struct in pngcp.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** png_create_info_struct in png.c in libpng 1.6.36 has a memory leak, as demonstrated by pngcp. NOTE: a third party has stated "I don't think it is libpng's job to free this buffer."

Vulnerabilities.Title: postgresql: Command injection via "COPY TO/FROM PROGRAM" function
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** In PostgreSQL 9.3 through 11.2, the "COPY TO/FROM PROGRAM" function allows superusers and users in the 'pg_execute_server_program' group to execute arbitrary code in the context of the database's operating system user. This functionality is enabled by default and can be abused to run arbitrary operating system commands on Windows, Linux, and macOS. NOTE: Third parties claim/state this is not an issue because PostgreSQL functionality for ‘COPY TO/FROM PROGRAM’ is acting as intended. References state that in PostgreSQL, a superuser can execute commands as the server user without using the ‘COPY FROM PROGRAM’.

Vulnerabilities.Title: postgresql: Command injection via "COPY TO/FROM PROGRAM" function
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** In PostgreSQL 9.3 through 11.2, the "COPY TO/FROM PROGRAM" function allows superusers and users in the 'pg_execute_server_program' group to execute arbitrary code in the context of the database's operating system user. This functionality is enabled by default and can be abused to run arbitrary operating system commands on Windows, Linux, and macOS. NOTE: Third parties claim/state this is not an issue because PostgreSQL functionality for ‘COPY TO/FROM PROGRAM’ is acting as intended. References state that in PostgreSQL, a superuser can execute commands as the server user without using the ‘COPY FROM PROGRAM’.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Generic FAQ wizard moving tool insecure auxiliary /tmp file usage (symlink attack possible)
Vulnerabilities.Description: Tools/faqwiz/move-faqwiz.sh (aka the generic FAQ wizard moving tool) in Python 2.4.5 might allow local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a tmp$RANDOM.tmp temporary file.  NOTE: there may not be common usage scenarios in which tmp$RANDOM.tmp is located in an untrusted directory.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: wrong backtracking in urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler allows for a ReDoS
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7 through 2.7.17, 3.5 through 3.5.9, 3.6 through 3.6.10, 3.7 through 3.7.6, and 3.8 through 3.8.1 allows an HTTP server to conduct Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks against a client because of urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler catastrophic backtracking.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: hash secret can be recovered remotely
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7 before 3.4 only uses the last eight bits of the prefix to randomize hash values, which causes it to compute hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably and makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-1150.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Command injection in Lib/webbrowser.py
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** Lib/webbrowser.py in Python through 3.6.3 does not validate strings before launching the program specified by the BROWSER environment variable, which might allow remote attackers to conduct argument-injection attacks via a crafted URL. NOTE: a software maintainer indicates that exploitation is impossible because the code relies on subprocess.Popen and the default shell=False setting.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Cookie domain check returns incorrect results
Vulnerabilities.Description: http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy.domain_return_ok in Lib/http/cookiejar.py in Python before 3.7.3 does not correctly validate the domain: it can be tricked into sending existing cookies to the wrong server. An attacker may abuse this flaw by using a server with a hostname that has another valid hostname as a suffix (e.g., pythonicexample.com to steal cookies for example.com). When a program uses http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy and tries to do an HTTP connection to an attacker-controlled server, existing cookies can be leaked to the attacker. This affects 2.x through 2.7.16, 3.x before 3.4.10, 3.5.x before 3.5.7, 3.6.x before 3.6.9, and 3.7.x before 3.7.3.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: email.utils.parseaddr wrongly parses email addresses
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in Python through 2.7.16, 3.x through 3.5.7, 3.6.x through 3.6.9, and 3.7.x through 3.7.4. The email module wrongly parses email addresses that contain multiple @ characters. An application that uses the email module and implements some kind of checks on the From/To headers of a message could be tricked into accepting an email address that should be denied. An attack may be the same as in CVE-2019-11340; however, this CVE applies to Python more generally.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: XSS vulnerability in the documentation XML-RPC server in server_title field
Vulnerabilities.Description: The documentation XML-RPC server in Python through 2.7.16, 3.x through 3.6.9, and 3.7.x through 3.7.4 has XSS via the server_title field. This occurs in Lib/DocXMLRPCServer.py in Python 2.x, and in Lib/xmlrpc/server.py in Python 3.x. If set_server_title is called with untrusted input, arbitrary JavaScript can be delivered to clients that visit the http URL for this server.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: CRLF injection via the host part of the url passed to urlopen()
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.17 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.8.0. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the host component of a URL) followed by an HTTP header. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 query string issue and the CVE-2019-9947 path string issue. (This is not exploitable when glibc has CVE-2016-10739 fixed.)

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: NULL pointer dereference using a specially crafted X509 certificate
Vulnerabilities.Description: An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the X509 certificate parser of Python.org Python 2.7.11 / 3.6.6. A specially crafted X509 certificate can cause a NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker can initiate or accept TLS connections using crafted certificates to trigger this vulnerability.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Information Disclosure due to urlsplit improper NFKC normalization
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7.x through 2.7.16 and 3.x through 3.7.2 is affected by: Improper Handling of Unicode Encoding (with an incorrect netloc) during NFKC normalization. The impact is: Information disclosure (credentials, cookies, etc. that are cached against a given hostname). The components are: urllib.parse.urlsplit, urllib.parse.urlparse. The attack vector is: A specially crafted URL could be incorrectly parsed to locate cookies or authentication data and send that information to a different host than when parsed correctly.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Nested zip file (Zip bomb) vulnerability in Lib/zipfile.py
Vulnerabilities.Description: Lib/zipfile.py in Python through 3.7.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via a ZIP bomb.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: CRLF injection via the query part of the url passed to urlopen()
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the query string after a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: CRLF injection via the path part of the url passed to urlopen()
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the path component of a URL that lacks a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 query string issue.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Undocumented local_file protocol allows remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms
Vulnerabilities.Description: urllib in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 supports the local_file: scheme, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms that blacklist file: URIs, as demonstrated by triggering a urllib.urlopen('local_file:///etc/passwd') call.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Heap-Buffer-Overflow and Heap-Use-After-Free in Objects/fileobject.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7.14 is vulnerable to a Heap-Buffer-Overflow as well as a Heap-Use-After-Free. Python versions prior to 2.7.14 may also be vulnerable and it appears that Python 2.7.17 and prior may also be vulnerable however this has not been confirmed. The vulnerability lies when multiply threads are handling large amounts of data. In both cases there is essentially a race condition that occurs. For the Heap-Buffer-Overflow, Thread 2 is creating the size for a buffer, but Thread1 is already writing to the buffer without knowing how much to write. So when a large amount of data is being processed, it is very easy to cause memory corruption using a Heap-Buffer-Overflow. As for the Use-After-Free, Thread3->Malloc->Thread1->Free's->Thread2-Re-uses-Free'd Memory. The PSRT has stated that this is not a security vulnerability due to the fact that the attacker must be able to run code, however in some situations, such as function as a service, this vulnerability can potentially be used by an attacker to violate a trust boundary, as such the DWF feels this issue deserves a CVE.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: wrong backtracking in urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler allows for a ReDoS
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7 through 2.7.17, 3.5 through 3.5.9, 3.6 through 3.6.10, 3.7 through 3.7.6, and 3.8 through 3.8.1 allows an HTTP server to conduct Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks against a client because of urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler catastrophic backtracking.

NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-1150.

A specially crafted X509 certificate can cause a NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker can initiate or accept TLS connections using crafted certificates to trigger this vulnerability.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Information Disclosure due to urlsplit improper NFKC normalization
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7.x through 2.7.16 and 3.x through 3.7.2 is affected by: Improper Handling of Unicode Encoding (with an incorrect netloc) during NFKC normalization. The impact is: Information disclosure (credentials, cookies, etc. that are cached against a given hostname). The components are: urllib.parse.urlsplit, urllib.parse.urlparse. The attack vector is: A specially crafted URL could be incorrectly parsed to locate cookies or authentication data and send that information to a different host than when parsed correctly.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Nested zip file (Zip bomb) vulnerability in Lib/zipfile.py
Vulnerabilities.Description: Lib/zipfile.py in Python through 3.7.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via a ZIP bomb.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: CRLF injection via the query part of the url passed to urlopen()
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the query string after a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: CRLF injection via the path part of the url passed to urlopen()
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the path component of a URL that lacks a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 query string issue.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Undocumented local_file protocol allows remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms
Vulnerabilities.Description: urllib in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 supports the local_file: scheme, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms that blacklist file: URIs, as demonstrated by triggering a urllib.urlopen('local_file:///etc/passwd') call.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Heap-Buffer-Overflow and Heap-Use-After-Free in Objects/fileobject.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7.14 is vulnerable to a Heap-Buffer-Overflow as well as a Heap-Use-After-Free. Python versions prior to 2.7.14 may also be vulnerable and it appears that Python 2.7.17 and prior may also be vulnerable however this has not been confirmed. The vulnerability lies when multiply threads are handling large amounts of data. In both cases there is essentially a race condition that occurs. For the Heap-Buffer-Overflow, Thread 2 is creating the size for a buffer, but Thread1 is already writing to the buffer without knowing how much to write. So when a large amount of data is being processed, it is very easy to cause memory corruption using a Heap-Buffer-Overflow. As for the Use-After-Free, Thread3->Malloc->Thread1->Free's->Thread2-Re-uses-Free'd Memory. The PSRT has stated that this is not a security vulnerability due to the fact that the attacker must be able to run code, however in some situations, such as function as a service, this vulnerability can potentially be used by an attacker to violate a trust boundary, as such the DWF feels this issue deserves a CVE.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: wrong backtracking in urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler allows for a ReDoS
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7 through 2.7.17, 3.5 through 3.5.9, 3.6 through 3.6.10, 3.7 through 3.7.6, and 3.8 through 3.8.1 allows an HTTP server to conduct Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks against a client because of urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler catastrophic backtracking.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Command injection in Lib/webbrowser.py
Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** Lib/webbrowser.py in Python through 3.6.3 does not validate strings before launching the program specified by the BROWSER environment variable, which might allow remote attackers to conduct argument-injection attacks via a crafted URL. NOTE: a software maintainer indicates that exploitation is impossible because the code relies on subprocess.Popen and the default shell=False setting.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Integer overflow in Modules/_pickle.c allows for memory exhaustion if serializing gigabytes of data
Vulnerabilities.Description: Modules/_pickle.c in Python before 3.7.1 has an integer overflow via a large LONG_BINPUT value that is mishandled during a "resize to twice the size" attempt. This issue might cause memory exhaustion, but is only relevant if the pickle format is used for serializing tens or hundreds of gigabytes of data.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Cookie domain check returns incorrect results
Vulnerabilities.Description: http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy.domain_return_ok in Lib/http/cookiejar.py in Python before 3.7.3 does not correctly validate the domain: it can be tricked into sending existing cookies to the wrong server. An attacker may abuse this flaw by using a server with a hostname that has another valid hostname as a suffix (e.g., pythonicexample.com to steal cookies for example.com). When a program uses http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy and tries to do an HTTP connection to an attacker-controlled server, existing cookies can be leaked to the attacker. This affects 2.x through 2.7.16, 3.x before 3.4.10, 3.5.x before 3.5.7, 3.6.x before 3.6.9, and 3.7.x before 3.7.3.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: email.utils.parseaddr wrongly parses email addresses
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in Python through 2.7.16, 3.x through 3.5.7, 3.6.x through 3.6.9, and 3.7.x through 3.7.4. The email module wrongly parses email addresses that contain multiple @ characters. An application that uses the email module and implements some kind of checks on the From/To headers of a message could be tricked into accepting an email address that should be denied. An attack may be the same as in CVE-2019-11340; however, this CVE applies to Python more generally.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: XSS vulnerability in the documentation XML-RPC server in server_title field
Vulnerabilities.Description: The documentation XML-RPC server in Python through 2.7.16, 3.x through 3.6.9, and 3.7.x through 3.7.4 has XSS via the server_title field. This occurs in Lib/DocXMLRPCServer.py in Python 2.x, and in Lib/xmlrpc/server.py in Python 3.x. If set_server_title is called with untrusted input, arbitrary JavaScript can be delivered to clients that visit the http URL for this server.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: CRLF injection via the host part of the url passed to urlopen()
Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.17 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.8.0. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the host component of a URL) followed by an HTTP header. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 query string issue and the CVE-2019-9947 path string issue. (This is not exploitable when glibc has CVE-2016-10739 fixed.)

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: NULL pointer dereference using a specially crafted X509 certificate
Vulnerabilities.Description: An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the X509 certificate parser of Python.org Python 2.7.11 / 3.6.6. A specially crafted X509 certificate can cause a NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker can initiate or accept TLS connections using crafted certificates to trigger this vulnerability.

Vulnerabilities.Title: python: Information Disclosure due to urlsplit improper NFKC normalization
Vulnerabilities.Description: Python 2.7.x through 2.7.16 and 3.x through 3.7.2 is affected by: Improper Handling of Unicode Encoding (with an incorrect netloc) during NFKC normalization.
